title: Standard form of a circle
text: The standard form of a circle is $${\left(x-h\right)}^2+{\left(y-k\right)}^2=r^2$$.

title: Center
text: The center of an equation of a circle in standard form is (h,k). We can rewrite the equation as $${\left(x-1\right)}^2+{\left(y-0\right)}^2=6^2$$. From here we get the center is $$(1,0)$$.

title: Radius
text: The radius of an equation of a circle in standard form is simply the $$r$$ value. Note that in the standard form of the circle, $$r$$ is squared. We can rewrite the equation as $${\left(x-1\right)}^2+{\left(y-0\right)}^2=6^2$$. From here we get the radius is $$6$$.
